title: How are you taking care of your fitness during this lockdown? - Quora

response.answer_text: Until somedays back, I didn't pay much attention to taking care of my physical health, but from the past few weeks I've decided, not to excuse myself from it. I am not an early morning person, but I find it best to exercise then, because at all other times I make excuses like, it is too hot, it's dark, I am already tired, etc… So I've decided that once I'll get up in the morning at six, exercise for an hour, and then go back to sleep. So far, it has been great and is working for me, somedays when I was unable to sleep at night properly I'd try to excuse myself, but now instead I try to cut short the time I exercise for, rather than completely leaving it out and somedays I end up completing my target. So for me it is just a matter of getting out of bed.

By working out and eating as good as possible. My current Training Split- Full Body Workout - 3x in a week Meditation and Breathing Exercises - 3x in a week Check this space for Exercise videos- Tips for Health & Fitness

I ensure I complete my 2400 kcal intake.Sleep at least for 8 hrs.Avoid junk foods.Drinks loads of water during the day.Perform Bodyweight exercises.Knuckle Pushups :- 50 Reps at one go. Jump ropes :- 500 Reps at one go. Pullups :- 15 Reps at one go. I make sure I complete this routine within 20–25 mins.
By Rope Skipping at homeBy improving my flexibility on a daily basis via yogaSpot runningSpot jumpingHand circuit for forearm strength By attempting yoga postures early morning on an empty stomach
